3.label: IR Listen period
3.description: Additional time for feedback measurement. Should always be 0.

4.label: IR Pulse Width
4.description: Adjusts transmit signal so received signal will in average be equal to this values.

5.label: Poll / Wake up frequency
5.description: Wake device up this many times per second. This value also controls number of measurements per second on mechanical meters

6.label: Pulse Threshold Low
6.description: Low detection threshold for wheel meters

7.label: Pulse Threshold High
7.description: High detection threshold for wheel meters

9.label: Pulse count
9.description: Current pulse count in device (pulse count / pulse factor = kWh)

10.label: Keep alive period
10.description: How many ticks before going back to sleep in normal wakeup mode.

11.label: Real-time mode
11.description: Set this to enter real-time mode from remote. Contains seconds * poll frequency before going back to sleep. If you press the button once this value will be set.
